intro: Polycarpaea kuriensis, commonly known as the Kuriensis milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Polycarpaea kuriensis is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations above 2,000 meters.
